Dear Andrea Renee Melendrez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• Be signed and dated.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. You must contest or agree to the
issuance of a provisional license in writing, on the CWL-4617 within 15 days, with
submission of the corrective action plan. If you do not submit the CWL-4617, it will be
treated as contested. Even if you contest the issuance of a provisional license, you must
still submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at triestramc@michigan.gov or 616-552-
3662.
Sincerely,
Tracey Ventola, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was restrained incorrectly resulting in a bruise on Youth C’s
arm.
Youth J’s ears are twisted and/or pulled by another staff member
as a form of discipline as ears do not bruise.
Another staff member performed two one person restraints on
youth inappropriately.
Investigation This complaint was received on 5/31/23 and jointly investigated
with the Government Worker. The complaint noted the following:
Youth C (10) and Youth J (9) reside at Genacross Lutheran
Service in Adrian Michigan. Youth Worker B and Youth Worker M
are staff members at Genacross Lutheran Service in Adrian
Michigan. On 5/27/23 Youth C was upset at bedtime and Youth
Worker M tried to restrain Youth C incorrectly and hurt Youth C’s
arm. Youth C squeezed Youth Worker M’s hand and Youth
Worker M pushed her on the bed. Youth C has bruises on the
right arm. The bruises are purple and the outline of an adult's
hand. On 5/27/23 Youth Worker B pulled on Youth J’s ears
because it does not leave marks. Youth Worker B always pulls-on
Youth J’s ears to teach him a lesson for biting people. On 5/29/23
the Client Rights Services Coordinator at Genacross Lutheran
Service was given the allegations of abuse. She will put protection
plan in place where Youth Worker B and Youth Worker M will not
be able to work with Youth C and Youth J.
On 6/5/23 an additional complaint was received alleging the
following:
Youth J (10) and Youth B (9) are Michigan state wards placed at
Adrian Group Home. Youth Worker Z is a staff member employed
at the facility. On 05/29/23, Youth Worker Z used unapproved
techniques to manage Youth J and Youth B. Specifically, Youth
2

Worker Z used a one person hold to manage Youth J as well as
Youth B during separate incidents that occurred that day. Staff
are not permitted to conduct restraints by themselves. Although
Youth Worker Z conducted these restraints unassisted no harm
came to either child. There are no concerns of abuse or neglect,
but Youth Worker Z has been placed on a safety plan in which he
cannot work alone with any resident, and he can't be involved in
any restraints whatsoever. Youth Worker Z has no history of
disciplinary action or issues.
I interviewed Youth C face to face at Haviland School with the
Government Worker on 5/31/23. Youth C reported she lives at
Adrian Home and that she likes some of the kids there and some
bully her. Youth C was able to identify some of the staff that work
at the facility and when asked about staff she reported that Youth
Worker M hurt her arm and pulled back her sleeve and showed us
a purplish bruise. The bruise was on the top of her right arm
between the elbow and wrist and had a finger like appearance.
Youth C reported that she got the bruise when she was in her
room and Youth Worker M grabbed her arm. Youth C reported
she wanted her light off and Youth Worker M grabbed and pulled
her arm to stop her from turning off the light.
Youth C reported she went to turn off the light in her room and
Youth Worker M thought she was going to “attack her”. Youth C
reported that Team Leader D was also in her room, and he was
standing in front of her bedroom window so she could not break
the window or climb out. Youth C reported she told a lady at the
facility about her arm, but she couldn't remember her name. Youth
C reported she feels safe "most of the time" and then said, "I don't
know; I don't feel safe when people hurt me like, Youth Worker M".
I interviewed Youth J at Michener Elementary School on 5/31/23
face to face with the Government Worker. He reported he likes to
go outside and play and said he lives in a house with other kids.
Youth J reported he doesn't like when he gets restrained,
reporting, "it just hurts". Youth J reported he was restrained
yesterday but couldn't remember who restrained him. When
asked if the restraint was inside the house or outside, he reported
in the house and "maybe not yesterday". Youth J reported he
likes most of the staff at the facility except for Youth Worker B.
Youth J reported "she is nice but mean when she is mad.” He
then reported "she was pulling my ears". Youth J said he thinks it
happened on Saturday and he was in his room sitting on his bed
and he was being bad. Youth J reported Youth Worker B pulled
both his ears at once and he had to put his head down to escape.
3

Youth J reported Youth Worker B also tried to break his toe by
pushing on it with her hand. Youth J denied his toe was injured.
Youth J reported that he has never seen Youth Worker B pull any
other kid's ears. Youth J became visibly angry when talking about
his ears being pulled and put his head down on the table and
began to yell his answers to the questions being asked. Youth J
reported he felt mad when Youth Worker B pulled his ears. Youth
J reported he told Chief Administrator A about youth Worker B
pulling his ears.
I interviewed Team Leader D on 5/31/23 face to face at the facility
with the Government Worker. He reported he has been in
employment with Adrian Group Home for approximately one
month and was recently promoted to Team Leader. Team Leader
D reported after becoming employed with the facility he became
concerned about the behavior he saw other employees exhibit
and that was accepted. He went on to say that it appeared to be
an "old school" parenting type of approach with yelling and anger
and not using verbal de-escalation techniques. Team Leader D
reported he began bringing in activities and things to do with the
youth as he felt this would assist with time being more structured
and constructive for the youth.
Team Leader D reported on 5/27/23 the residents were watching
a movie and Youth C spilled water on Youth N. Youth C and
Youth N began to argue, and it was time for bed. Team Leader D
reported Youth N went to the bathroom and Youth C ran into
Youth N's bedroom. Team Leader D and Youth Worker M went
into Youth N's bedroom and attempted to get Youth C to leave.
Team Leader D reported that Youth Worker M was angry and
confrontational with Youth C and it upset Youth C. Youth C began
to kick and punch Youth Worker M and Team Leader D. Team
Leader D reported they told Youth C they were going to transport
her to her room. He reported Youth C was on Youth N's bed and
was reclined on the bed. Team Leader D reported Youth Worker
M grabbed both of Youth C's legs and he held Youth C's upper
body, and they went across the hall with her to her bedroom.
Team Leader D reported they released her standing up in her
room. Team Leader D reported he did not think that was how they
would transport Youth C, but when Youth Worker M grabbed
Youth C’s legs he felt he had to support Youth C's back and upper
body. Team Leader D reported he knew this was not an
appropriate transport. Team Leader D reported upon releasing
Youth C she began to fight with Youth Worker M by punching her
and Youth C began to try and bang on her bedroom window.
Team Leader D reported he stood in front of the window to block
4

Youth C. Team Leader D reported that Youth C was punching
Youth Worker M and Youth Worker M was blocking her and
yelling at her "you stop this".
Team Leader D reported that Youth Worker M and Youth C got
into "a shoving match" and he became concerned about Youth
Worker M's anger, and he opened the window to let Youth C leave
the situation. Team Leader D reported that Youth C began to yell
" I want out of here" and Youth Worker M was becoming more
escalated so he opened the window and told Youth C she could
go out, but it would be considered AWOL. Team Leader D
reported Youth C did go out the window and he followed her out
the window and Youth Worker M called the police. Team Leader D
reported he followed Youth C around the parking lot keeping her
away from rocks and windows. Team Leader D reported at one
point Youth C got herself caught in a pricker bush and he helped
her get out, but she did get a couple scratches. Team Leader D
reported that Youth C eventually said she was hungry, and he
offered to go inside and make her popcorn which she agreed to
do. Team Leader D reported the police arrived about that time
and he told them they were all set, and they could leave as Youth
C had calmed down and was going inside to have popcorn. Team
Leader D reported he provided Youth C with some popcorn and
put on a cake making video and she calmed down and then went
to bed. Team Leader D reported that Youth Worker M felt that
Youth C should have had to talk to the police as a consequence
for her behavior. Team Leader D reported he saw a couple of
scratches/red marks on Youth C's arms and a couple of days later
he saw the bruise on her arm. Team Leader D reported he was
unsure how Youth C got the bruises as she was hitting and
punching a lot of things that evening and he did not remember
seeing Youth Worker M grab Youth C’s arm. Team Leader D
reported that same evening Youth J was hitting and biting at staff,
but he was outside with Youth C during that time.
I interviewed Youth Worker A on 6/1/23 face to face at the facility
in collaboration with the Government Worker. Youth Worker A
reported she started working at Adrian Group Home on 5/15/23
and is a full-time employee. She reported her husband, and she
were the anonymous referral sources as she was upset about
what was happening at work and he called to report and then she
got on the phone to provide more detail. Youth Worker A reported
she was working the evening that Youth C became upset and was
carried across the hallway and climbed out her window. Youth
Worker A reported that Youth Worker M was getting loud and
rough with Youth C and she heard Youth C say “ouch stop bitch
5

you are hurting me”. Youth Worker A reported she saw the hand
mark bruise Youth C had on her arm a few days later. Youth
Worker A reported that on the evening of 5/27/23 Youth C didn’t
want to go to bed, and she doesn’t like being told no. Youth
Worker A reported that Youth C began swinging on staff, choked
her by grabbing the keys she had around her neck and pulled her
hair. Youth Worker A felt Youth C felt trapped in her room that
evening with her, Youth Worker M, and Team Leader D in her
room. Youth Worker A reported that Youth Worker M turned on
the light in the room and Youth C tried to turn it off and Youth
Worker M grabbed Youth C’s arm and pushed her. Youth Worker
A heard Youth C say, “stop hurting me”.
Youth Worker A reported that Youth J told her that Youth Worker
B yanks on his ears. On 5/27/23 Youth Worker A heard Youth J
call Youth Worker B a bitch. Youth Worker A reported Youth
Worker B came out of Youth J’s room and was smiling and said
she pulls on Youth J’s ears to get him to listen and to not bite her.
Youth Worker A reported that Youth Worker B told her this was
not the first time she had done this, and she does it as it doesn’t
bruise. Youth Worker A reported that Youth Worker B told her she
thinks Youth J had such a good day on 5/27/23 because she
pulled his ears, and he remembered it. Youth A reported the next
day Youth J told her that Youth Worker B pulls on his ears, and it
makes him mad. Youth Worker A reported Client Rights Services
Coordinator about Youth C’s bruised arm and Youth J’s ear
pulling.
Youth Worker A reported that on 5/30/23 Youth C was upset and
was going after Youth A and Youth Worker M grabbed Youth C’s
arm and pulled her into the hallway and the Client Rights Services
Coordinator saw it. Youth Worker A reported that Youth Worker M
is over worked and tired and that she won’t assist with or do
restraints when needed, which is dangerous. Youth Worker A
reported that there have been many times when youth are causing
physical harm to self or others, and they should have restrained
and didn’t.
Youth Worker A reported that Youth Worker Z does restraints
wrong and picks up youth by himself and carries them under his
arm with their feet off the ground. She reported she has seen him
do this with Youth S and Youth B. She reported that Youth Worker
Z is “very loud and scares me truthfully”. Youth worker A reported
that she observed Youth Worker Z pick a youth up off the floor
that was refusing the get up and eat his dinner. Youth Worker A
said the resident was on the ground so we shouldn’t touch him.
6

Youth Worker A reported she was not provided with mandated
reporter training.
I interviewed Youth N at the facility face to face with the
Government Worker on 6/1/23. She reported she has been on a
visit with her mentor family and upon her return to the facility
Youth C had bruises and the cops had been called. Youth N
reported that Youth C and Youth Worker M butted heads that
evening and she shut her bedroom door to avoid it. Youth N
reported that she has seen Youth Worker B touch Youth J’s ears.
She reported seeing Youth Worker B twist Youth J’s ears in the
hallway about 2-3 weeks ago.
I interviewed Youth Worker M on 6/1/23 at the facility face to face
with the Government Worker. Youth Worker M reported that at
bedtime Youth C went off on Youth N. She reported Youth N went
into the bathroom and Youth C was trying to go in all the
resident’s bedrooms. Youth Worker M reported that she and Team
Leader D moved Youth C out of Youth N’s room by her carrying
Youth C’s legs and Team Leader D carrying Youth C under the
arms. Youth Worker M reported they placed her on her bed and
Youth C began yelling, punching, kicking and lunging at her. She
reported that she would push Youth C back away from her when
she lunged at her. Youth Worker M reported Youth C was
grabbing at Youth Worker M’s necklace and got a hold of Youth
Worker M’s pinky and broke it. Youth Worker M reported that
Youth C jumped out her window and staff followed her, and they
called the cops. Youth Worker M denied that Team Leader D
opened the window to let Youth C out. Youth Worker M reported
that Youth C was not hurt. Youth Worker M reported on 5/30/23
Youth C said to her “you hurt me” and punched her. Youth
Worker M reported she went in the staff office to stay away from
Youth C after Youth C punched her. Youth Worker M denied that
she grabbed Youth C’s arm and then stated, “maybe I might
have”. Youth Worker M was asked about restraints, and she
reported there have to have 2 people and they must hold the
youth under the arm and when transporting they hold the arm to
carry them.
I interviewed the Chief Administrator on 5/31/23 face to face at the
facility in collaboration with the Government Worker. She reported
she was called on Saturday 5/27/23 by Team Leader D who
reported the incident with Youth C and that they called the police
because Youth C went out the window. The Chief Administrator
reported the Client Rights Services Coordinator prompted her to
talk to staff as Youth Worker A had told her she was upset about
7

Youth Worker B pulling Youth J’s ears. The chief Administrator
reported that the Client Rights Services Coordinator did not tell
her what Youth C had told her about her arm and the bruise. The
Chief Administrator reported she was unclear and didn’t have all
the information about what occurred over the holiday weekend
from 5/27/23 to 5/30/23. The Chief Administrator reported that
she talked with staff on 5/30/23 about the incidents but still
seemed unclear on 5/31/23 when she was interviewed. The Chief
Administrator reported that Team Leader D called her on 5/31/23
after the incident with Youth C throwing things in the kitchen and
the police being called.
I interviewed the Client Rights services Coordinator via the phone
on 5/31/23 in collaboration with the Government Worker. She
reported that Youth C reported to her on 5/29/23 that she had a
bruise on her arm from Youth Worker M. Client Rights services
Coordinator felt Youth C’s arm appeared to have a scratch on it
and said it could have been a finger mark. She reported that
Youth C was aggressive with Youth Worker M and Youth Worker
M held her arm to keep her away and Youth C broke Youth
Worker M’s finger. She reported Youth C did not know how she
got the marks on her arm but said she was hurt in her room by
Youth Worker M when turning her light switch off. Client Rights
Services Coordinator reported that she was at the facility on
5/30/23 and Youth C had been told no to watching more television
and it was time to get ready for bed. She reported that Youth C
became angry and was screaming and being disrespectful. She
reported they tried to calm her down and get her to do a quiet
activity like reading or cooking but Youth C was banging on the
walls and went into peers’ rooms and “had no control over
herself”. She reported Youth C went into the kitchen and began to
throw food around and dumped the water cooler of water and “this
went on forever”. She reported staff were afraid to touch her or
restrain her due to other incidents the past few days. She reported
that Youth C was provoking Youth Worker M and they had to have
Youth Worker M leave the area. Youth C was saying to Youth
Worker M that she had hurt her a few days earlier. Client Rights
Services Coordinator reported that Youth Worker A told her that
Youth Worker B reported to her that she pulled Youth J’s ears.
Client Rights Services Coordinator reported she told this
information to Chief Administrator the next day, 5/30/23.
I interviewed Youth Worker B face to face at the library in Adrian
on 6/6/23 in collaboration with the Government Worker. She
reported she has been employed with the facility for 90 days and
resigned this week due to medical reasons. Youth Worker B
8

denied ever pulling on Youth J’s ears and indicated Youth J was
seated on his bed and was upset and was trying to bite, head butt,
punch, kick, and was throwing books so she held his head with
her hands on top of his ears to secure his head. Youth Worker B
reported she was also trying to massage his head. She reported
she held his head for 30 seconds and it was the only time she
held his head. Youth worker B reported that Team Leader D was
outside with Youth C during this time and Youth Worker M and
Youth Worker A were outside of Youth J’s room. Youth Worker B
reported she did this to keep him from hurting himself. Youth
Worker B reported they can only do a restraint of a youth with two
people, and she received training, and they can only do a restraint
if a youth is a risk to themselves or others. Youth Worker B did
not consider what she did a restraint. Youth Worker B denied ever
telling another staff that she pinches Youth J’s ears because it
doesn’t leave marks. Youth Worker B denied seeing any marks or
bruises on Youth C and denied that staff are doing inappropriate
restraints or transports. Youth Worker B reported she never heard
Youth C say she was hurt by Youth Worker M.
I interviewed Youth Worker Z on 6/6/23 face to face at the facility
in collaboration with the Government Worker. He reported he
worked on 5/30/23, Memorial Day, and they were short staffed as
an employee had called off first shift. He reported they took the
residents to the parade and the day went well until dinner time.
Youth Worker Z reported he was working with two new co-
workers, Youth Worker A and Youth Worker G, who came on mid-
day. Youth Worker Z reported that Youth J was at the dinner
table and was talking about diarrhea in “too much detail”. Youth
Worker Z reported at dinner time he typically calls up one youth at
a time to get their plate and the other staff allowed the kids to
come into the kitchen and it was “a free for all”. Youth Worker Z
reported that Youth Q had trouble with his salad portion and
dropped his plate spilling some of the food on the table. Youth
Worker Z stated, “we only have the ability to handle one problem
at a time at this facility“. Youth Worker Z reported he sent Youth
Q who was upset about his salad to his room for a 5-minute reset.
Youth Worker Z reported he was very frustrated that day and felt
he had to handle everything as the other staff were so new. Youth
Q, upon being sent to his room, punched the wall. Youth Worker
Z reported Youth Q needed first aid for a minor skin break from
punching the wall which he provided. Youth Worker Z reported at
the same time Youth J was passing gas at the dinner table and he
was worried he was “going to mess himself” as he was forcing out
more gas. Youth Worker Z reported he sent Youth J to his room
9

for a 5-minute reset, and he responded with “make me”. Youth
Worker Z reported he picked up Youth J by his arm and carried
him to his room and placed him on his bed. Youth Worker Z
reported he didn’t follow protocol for transporting a youth but
“nobody got hurt and he was doing the best he could based on the
situation”. Youth Worker Z reported that youth tend to drop weight
and he didn’t want to drag Youth J so he picked him up and
carried him under his arm. Youth Worker Z reported he knows the
video looks bad, “like I man handled him”.
Youth Worker Z reported he then came back to the dinner table
and Youth S was having a problem with listening to the new staff
(Youth Worker A) and when Youth S gets mad “he becomes
zombie like, and his eyes roll in the back of his head “. Youth
Worker Z reported he grabbed Youth S by the arm and removed
him from the chair and he and Youth Worker A carried Youth S to
the sensory room where he handled it after that. Youth Worker Z
indicated again he handled the situation to the best of his ability.
Youth Worker Z reported his memory is foggy, but he believes
Youth S got out of the sensory room and went into the kitchen and
was on the floor and Youth Worker A was asking for help with
Youth S. Youth Worker Z reported that Youth Worker A was
scared of Youth S and it was common for him to see Youth S like
this so he picked him up off the kitchen floor by himself and took
him to the sensory room. Youth Worker Z then reported he knows
he was not supposed to pick up a youth off the ground and should
have just left him. Youth Worker Z denied that Youth S was a
threat when he was on the ground in the kitchen, and he “just
reacted” and put him in the sensory room. Youth Worker Z
reported, in the sensory room with Youth S, he couldn’t remember
if he had the door open or closed and said he got very loud with
Youth S and placed him on the bean bag in the room. Youth
worker Z indicated Youth S “is still in violent zombie mode” at this
time and I told him to “knock it off”. Youth Worker M reported the
time in the sensory room was approximately 20 minutes and then
Youth S calmed down. Youth Worker Z couldn’t remember if he
held the door shut with Youth S in the sensory room or not.
Youth Worker Z was very upset during the interview and was
fluctuating between crying and justifying his actions multiple times.
He reported that he was reacting to the situations and “it was not
that big of an issue” and then stated, “I am fairly new myself”. He
also reported he did not classify anything he did as a restraint.
Youth Worker Z reported that they engage in too many activities at
the facility and that the youth become over stimulated and can’t
transition. He went on to say that he knows other facilities do not
10

do activities with the youth to avoid this. Youth Worker Z reported
“I was trying to take care of everything, be the man of the
situation”. Youth Worker Z reported the youth are allowed to
jump on his back so he should be able to pick them up. He also
reported “what I did was effective, and nobody was hurt “. Youth
Worker M reported he did write an incident report for Youth Q
punching the wall and destruction of property but didn’t write any
for his restraints or incidents with Youth Q, Youth S or Youth J as
he felt his incidents with them were minor.
This writer interviewed Youth S on 6/6/23 face to face at the
facility in collaboration with the Government Worker. Youth S
reported he likes Youth Worker Z and said Youth Worker Z gives
him candy secretly. He reported he doesn’t like it when Youth
Worker Z yells at him and he loses privileges. Youth S reported he
was restrained by Youth Worker Z and another staff when he
grabbed a knife, and they bent him over and took the knife from
him. Youth S could not recall a time when he was in the sensory
room.
I interviewed Youth Q on 6/6/23 face to face at the facility in
collaboration with the Government Worker. Youth Q reported he
likes most of the staff and didn’t have anything he didn’t like about
staff. Youth Q reported he remembered punching the wall and
indicated he does this often and couldn’t remember why he did it
besides that he got mad. He denied remembering anything about
dinner time or an incident at the dinner table.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
Adrian Group Home Program Statement-Genacross Family and
Youth Services’ primary purpose is to provide residential and
group home care and treatment within the continuum of care to
high-risk clients in open settings. This is accomplished with a high
staff to client ratio. Genacross Family and Youth Services uses an
integrated service delivery system that includes an emphasis on
outpatient treatment, family relationships, and education. Our goal
is to provide person-centered services to improve the quality of life
for individuals, families, and communities.
Incident Report dated 5/27/23 authored by Team Leader D.
Report is consistent with Team Leader’s interview.
No incident report was completed on 5/29/23.
Incident Report dated 5/30/23 authored by Team Leader D.
Report indicated Youth C wanted to fight with a peer, staff
11

intervened, and Youth C went out her window and attempted to go
in peer’s windows that she wanted to fight. She was redirected
back inside and then ran to the kitchen and began to throw food
items and police were called due to her escalated behaviors.
Police Report - Adrian Police 5/30/23 called due to Youth C
throwing items in kitchen and uncontrollable behavior. Officers
apprehended Youth C and escorted her to a room with no
windows. A staff member entered room with Youth C. No further
action.
Police Report - Adrian Police 5/27/23 called due to incorrigibility.
Youth C was outside attempting to be destructive and was AWOL.
Police arrived on scene at 8:47pm and were told by staff all was
under control and they were not needed.
VIDEO REVIEW:
5/27/23 West Hallway Video
Youth Q is goofing around in the hallway and Youth C is upset
with him and his goofing around and comes at him with her arm
up like she is going to strike him. Youth Worker B, A and Team
Leader D are trying to block Youth C from entering Youth Q’s
room and all other youth’s rooms.
8:36pm Staff are blocking Youth C’s ability to enter other residents
rooms with their bodies. (Blocking is an approved
technique.)
8:37pm Youth Worker M and Team Leader D escort Youth C to
her room. Youth C comes out of her room even though
Team Leader is attempting to block her with his body and
she is back in the hallway. Youth C enters another youth’s
room.
8:38pm Team Leader D and Youth Worker M are seen carrying
Youth C across the hallway with Youth Worker M holding
her feet and Youth C’s midsection hanging down and
Team Leader holding under her arms. (This is not an
approved technique.)
8:39pm Youth C exits her room and Team Leader is attempt to
block her way down the hallway, additional staff come and
are blocking with their bodies.
8:42pm Team Leader D, Youth Worker M and Youth Worker A are
still trying to block Youth C from coming down the hallway
with their bodies. Team Leader D enters Youth C’s room
after she goes in, and Youth Worker M also goes into the

Analysis Based on interviews and video there is evidence to support the
facility did not have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for
the continual needs, protection and supervision of residents.
Several staff performed unapproved transports and restraints of
multiple children leaving marks on one child.
• Youth C was carried across the hallway by Team Leader D

Youth C.
• Youth Worker M grabbed Youth C’s arm and pushed her.

appropriate way to manage his behavior.
• Youth Worker M got into a shoving match with Youth C
resulting in the Team Leader opening the window to allow
the youth to escape the situation and Youth Worker C

• Staff reported that Youth Worker M and Youth Worker Z
were loud and rough with the youth.
• Youth Worker Z removed three youth from the dining room
table forcibly and restraint them inappropriately not using
an approved restraint technique.
• Youth Worker Z secluded Youth J in the sensory room.
The staff working had limited experience and reported not being
able to handle the situations that were occurring and resorting to

youth resulting in a dangerous environment for youth. Staff

the environment unsafe for youth and staff.
